is the language of the kurdish people who live in the region known as Kurdistan that comprises of four countries

. The language is an Indo-European language. 
This phrase book is for the Kurmanji dialect which covers most of Bhadinan area of Iraqi Kurdistan and Kurdistan of southern Turkey.

; Hello. :  Slaw / Silav [si-lav] in Kurmanci
; Hello. (

) 
; How are you? :  To chon ye? (singular)
; How are you? :  Tu cawa yi? (singular) [tu chawa yi]
; How are you? :  Hun chawa nen? (plural)
; Fine, thank you. :  Spas, ez ji bashem!
; What is your name? :  Nawe to che ye (

)
; My name is ______ . :   Nawe min ______ ye . (

)
; Nice to meet you. :  Khosh hallim benasinit. (

. : Ez ne karim .... xeber debim.
; Do you speak Kurdish? : Tu Kurdi zane ?
;  Who speaks English here? : Ku di zaney Ingilizi wira? (

)
; I don't understand you. :  Ez te fahm na kim/ Ez te na gehem(

)
; Where is the toilet? :  Hemam li ku ye? (

)
; Right now. : esta/nucer
; I Love you : Ez te hezdikhem (North Kurdish) & Men hoshem dewey (South Kurdish)
; Do you have .... ? : .... te heye ?
; I am hungry. : Ez berche me.
; I am a foreigner. : Ez xerib im.

; Please notice: In kurdish language, pronouncation of "x" is not like in english. It sounds like "r" in german. Simply a thick "h" which comes from deep throat.
